Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: moiragreer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during holy week, I booked it on the winter package,which included breakfast, on checking in we were told that breakfast was not included, eventually the receptionist agreed as a gesture of goodwill that we could have breakfast.. although it was put on our bill on checking out,( the first receptionist hadnt documented this,) and after explaining yet again the breakfast charge was taken off our bill , it just took the good out of it as we were made feel like we were trying to get free breakfast! also the spa was out of service for 50% of our stay, this is unaceptable for a hotel of this standard without any prior warning. (the westin looks nice)

Reviews.Title: “Stylish!”
Reviews.Author: Ttravell
Reviews.Content: The Jumeirah group has obviously spent a good amount of money to spruce up this hotel and its service and it has been a good investment. Rome luxury hotels are notorious for pretentious and arrogant service and the Jumeirah is a welcome exception. The entire staff made us feel like they were glad we stayed there and offered service with elegance and class. The interior decoration of the rooms and public areas is top-notch, styled with a nod to Via Veneto's golden era, but not over-designed. My only advice to the Day Spa management would be to clearly point out their No Children under 16 policy. It is no easy task to deal with a 9-year old lured on a museum tour with the promise of a trip to the pool in the evening just to find the pool off limits to him...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Silent”
Reviews.Author: Dxtr1
Reviews.Content: We spent in Rome a whole week at the end of March 2012 with my wife as tourists. The hotel provides an excellent service. Hotel spa is very usefull after the long walkings, also it is a pleasure to relax in solyarium on the roof of the hotel. Hotel is very close to the historic center - it takes 10-30 minutes by feet to get to any central sightseengs (Forums or Basilica Sancti Petri), or 5 minutes and 8-12 euro by taxi. Very close to Villa Borghese. We appriciated very much the friendship of the hotel stuff. Also pay attention to very good rooms soundproofing. Breakfasts are rich, but quite expencive (33 euro) and it gets really crowdy sometimes in the dining room, so you can spend 10 minutes waiting for a fork or coffee. We tried to have breakfast in cafes nearby, it is also quite expencive and not tasty at all, so we came back to hotel breakfasts. Our best recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Poor reservation experience”
Reviews.Author: Zungyaci
Reviews.Content: As someone who has stayed at 3 different Jumeirah hotels before (Burj Al Arab, Jumeirah Beach and Madinat Jumeirah), I was naturally attracted to this newly opened Jumeirah hotel in Rome. Thinking that it may be a good idea to write directly to the hotel reservation to find out if any special rates could be offered, I set out the details of my family group (2 adults + 2 kids), the periods of our intended stay in Rome (for 2 different stays with a break in between), and the types of rooms we were interested in. The reservation responded rather promptly on the next day but the 'best rates' quoted were significantly higher than what I could get online by myself. For a 700 sq.ft Corner Suite, they quoted EUR 880 instead of their published online rate of EUR 720, or two interconnecting Deluxe Rooms for EUR 380 per room instead of the online rate of EUR 360 per room. I then wrote again to enquire about the discrepancies. They then came back in no time with a 'screen shot' maintaining that their quoted rate of EUR 380 for the Deluxe Rooms was correct, and further explained that their website had certain problems which failed to reveal the 3rd and 4th bed supplement charges for the Corner Suite (a total of EUR160 per night for two kids sleeping at the sitting area!). However, when I checked the online rate on the hotel's official website again, it still showed the rate of EUR 360 per room for the interconnecting Deluxe Rooms. I therefore captured my own 'screen shot' and sent it back to the reservation right away. I find this most disappointing because: (1) No customer will expect the rates published on a hotel's official website would be incorrect or not up to date. (2) No apology was offered for the wrong information published on the hotel website when they first responded (though they did apologize later when I showed them my own 'screen shot'). (3) No apology was offered for mistakenly quoting a wrong duration of my intended stay (though I had underlined the period of my stay and stating the number of nights). (4) Exploding a 'screen shot' in a reply email to a guest to justify a rate which was plainly wrong (or confusing to say the least) is simply unheard of. (5) If I were the hotel management, I would certainly have replied in a more apologetic manner and would have expressed my gratitude to the customer for pointing out such 'technical' problems on the hotel website. I must say that this experience falls far short of what I had expected as a result of my previous stays at Jumeirah hotels, a hotel group which has taken a great pride in opening and operating beyond 5-star hotels around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel via veneto”
Reviews.Author: lucasstein
Reviews.Content: We stayed last month for a long weekend! What can I say about Rome! It is the capital of the world, my most favorite city! It is an open museum! I love walking and getting lost in the old town! Pastas, pizzas, ice-creams, the cool Italian attitude, crazy driving, the style, the glory, the history….. We stayed this time at the brand new GHVV. The location is ok, not central, not far, the common areas are very stylish, the room as well with large bathroom with walk in shower and walk in wardrobe. The breakfast had a small variety but everything I needed and I liked was in a fine quality. The front office staff was very helpful at all times, they recommend places we liked a lot, and the porters were originally smiley. We didn t use the spa although it looked great because we used our all budget and time for shopping! The location is safe but there were not many restaurants around there. Room service was fast and they spoke good English. We were happy despite the high price.

Reviews.Title: “Service Service and Service!”
Reviews.Author: Helen34438
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from Rome-Florence-Rome trip. We stayed at the Hassler Hotel at first , but on the way back from Florence decided to try someplace new. And what a fabulous choice we made by picking the Grand Hotel Via Veneto. The staff was just phenomenal from start to finish from doormen to the managers! They were just so professional and so quick to help. They made us feel like we were traveling some different country (hope no offense taken). I mean no European attitude , just pure professionalism and kindness. Our room was cozy and done in beautiful colors. The bathroom was a nice size and had everything we needed including Bvlgari goodies I loved so much. The only one thing tho...The marble top of the bath was originally installed at the wrong angle, I think. So every time I had a shower large amount of water ended up under the bath window. But at the end of the day it wasn't a big deal for me, because we had a two time a day housekeeping. Our breakfast was included and had a nice variety from fruits to meats. It was a buffet style and they offered a prosecco at the time we traveled. There was a fresh coffee, tea and water available at the lobby for 24/7 and free of charge. Also we tried "Time"cafe and "Magnolia"restaurant. ''Time'' was always perfect for lunch or late bites and drinks. And "Magnolia'' was an outstanding choice for our last dinner in Rome. Both places had delicious food and impeccable service. I would definitely recommend this great hotel to all the travelers.

Reviews.Title: “The best if you can afford”
Reviews.Author: carlo500
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, Helpful staff perfect location. High prices for food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “so good!!”
Reviews.Author: jumanjii
Reviews.Content: So good! I love this hotel, we stayed there for a couple of days last year, and now came back. Service is wonderful. My room was not as I expected though. We payed a very high rate... Roma is the most beautiful city in the world!

Reviews.Title: “New and very modern”
Reviews.Author: cojusna
Reviews.Content: Location is not very good.Via Veneto street is not a very nice street as told.They don't bring iron to the room.They say because of safety reasons.But there is no room for to iron yourself and if you give them they want extremely high prices for ironing.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Georgearn
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with huge rooms and bathroom.The decoration was classical & stylish. My only complain was the lack of balcony and the noise of the next room... I would strongly recommend it and looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “luxury”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa v
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel with nice spa. The room was space full, good service and very good breakfast. They thought about every detail while building it.The only disappointment was the cold shower in the morning. When we told the receptionist about it, she reacted a bit annoyed and didn't pay much attention about it. That was the only bad thing.

Reviews.Title: “elegant hotel, perfect for Rome”
Reviews.Author: pfl0res
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed there after a Cruise, the Hotel was very nice and modern, it covered our expectations, until the last night that we had some troubled with the light at the room and nobody knew what to do with the light to fix the problem, the front desk instead of changing us in another "better room" for the last night and it was 10:30pm, he was not very smart and never knew what to do, until the doorman went to the room and took away the light, but it passed almost 2 hr. anyway for a Rome Hotel I will recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Italian Style”
Reviews.Author: Robbiejo4866
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights following a romantic sailing cruise from Athens. We had both been to Rome before but never stayed in the fashionable centre. We decided to go for the full "nine yards" (Imperial measurement in Rome). and were not disappointed. Rome in the sunshine of Autumn is wonderful, the people friendly and fashionable with so much to see but for me the friendly staff and stylish accommodation of the hotel made the holiday. The roof garden is beatiful and relaxing and a lovely place to chill out and read in the sunshine or there is the quite fantastic spa in the basement, that literally soaks away the aches and pains. Not cheap but a wonderful place to stay and walking distance to the city and many lovely cafes and bars, in the best setting in the World. Cafe de Paris and Harry's Bar are across the street and a moving feast of glamour and style. In Rome style is all important and it doesn't come better than the Grand Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “elegant and sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: fitzsmith
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from 5 nights at the Grand Via Veneto. The hotel exceeded our expectations. As with all great hotels, they clearly pride themselves on providing the highest level of service. We were there for 5 nights and they did not skip a beat, from the "always there" doorman to the attentive and very professional bar and breakfast staff. Our spacious and exquisitely appointed room was on the top floor with 2 beautiful "juliette" balconies offering iconic views of Rome. The hotel also has an absolutely gorgeous rooftop with comfortable seating and a fabulous spa/jacuzzi (we were there in November so they were not serving but it was a great spot to sit and relax at the end of the day). A pefect stay in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulleslie20
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week with my wife and thouroghly enjoyed Rome and this hotel in particular. The room was perfect, the staff were excellent and the spa facilties were very good for the City Centre. Location was perfect - with some nice restaurants / shops close by and not too far from many of Romes main attractions. A little expemsive perhaps but good value overall. I can recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gustavb
Reviews.Content: i've stayed only for one night on a business trip and i was sad i was there only for one day as i couldn't enjoy the hotel more. The room was perfect, two bathrooms, good bed, internet running fast enough, minibar equipped with nice welcome gifts from the hotel. yes, it is pricey - but you get an adequate service for that. i'd recommend the hotel for anyone who asks for lot and is ready to pay. very friendly stuff, breakfast choice was stunning and the hotel has even small bar with seating on the street so you can catch the atmosphere right away of the always busy Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but pricey”
Reviews.Author: snecyls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It was a good room in a good location. The breakfast buffet was excellent especially the bacon...it was to die for....(here's a tip...ask the chef to fry the bacon for you...it's much better than the mass pile of bacon in the buffet area). the breakfast crew were outstanding.we looked forward to it every morning.... I guess overall we were happy although it was a bit of a walk to the Via Condotti area and we felt the Intown Luxury House was much better located for a lot less money...

Reviews.Title: “central Rome hotel with great un discovered Spa facilities”
Reviews.Author: Ikorel
Reviews.Content: an OK city hotel, we were disapponted with the housekeeping service, despite us requesting room to be made up often it wasn't the bar and breakfast were un-reasonably expensive, however this is all irrelevant and forgivable if you take advantage of the fantastic Spa facilities, they have the biggest and best jacuzzi ever seen along with steam room and sauna. Staff were generally very helpful, and we felt overall decent value for money

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Grand Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FunIntheSun
Reviews.Content: The only problem I had with this hotel was my stay was far too short! From the moment we arrived the hotel and it's staff were excellent. The Bellboy met us promptly and retrieved our luggage - we had arrived 3 hours early for check-in and the hotel made every effort to accommodate us while we toured the city. Although our room was not ready, the Bellboy secured our luggage allowing us to go tour the Vatican prior to check-in. Complimentary lobby tea and coffee while checking in was quite nice after a long flight and an early morning arrival. The decor in this hotel is modern and sophisticated, with a beautiful lobby, and welcoming staff. Rooms are not huge but well detailed, complete with luxurious baths. The location is great and an easy walk to attractions like the Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese. A little further to Trevi fountain but not difficult. This should definitely be on your list of hotels to consider in Rome. We managed to find a great rate which made it all the more of a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5* and not Grand”
Reviews.Author: carotravel1
Reviews.Content: It takes more than a lovely building (which this was) and a good breakfast (which it was) to make a 5* hotel. It takes professional management, which was definitely missing here. The other hotels on our summer holiday were all much better managed than this hotel, even a 3* hotel we stayed at.The owner has clearly spent a lot of money on the building, but now needs to hire competent professional managers. A real disappointment, as other reviewers really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not much words are necessary.”
Reviews.Author: FernandoGomes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superb in all the ways. It´s true that it doesn´t have a concierge, but it is really necesary? The breakfast is realy great and the rooms... The only word that comes to mind is Fantastic. It´s the first hotel that I have been that the photos on the web were not as good as reality. Need more coments?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMiamiMiami
Reviews.Content: Excellent art deco hotel, in the Via Venetto, just one block away from the famous Excelsior hotel. Every single aspect of the hotel was 5 stars. Nothing to complain whatsoever. A true luxury hotel (at the corresponding high price) with modern and comfortable amenities. Will definitely return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Great room. Good location. Needs concierge.”
Reviews.Author: banker123
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in early September 2011. The room was beautiful - spacious, great bathroom and comfortable bed. The rooms and hotel were both beautifully appointed and decorated. The breakfast was great and had both a nice indoor and outdoor (courtyard) seating area. The spa was incredible and was nice to go to after a long day of touring in Rome. Here's the one thing about this hotel you should be aware - there is no concierge. The front desk staff also act as the concierge reps, however, they are not "trained" or informed to do this. A hotel of this size and caliber needs to have a dedicated concierge staff to help out with reservations and give restaurant recommendations. If you already have restaurants picked out and already have reservations made, this shouldn't be an issue for you.

Reviews.Title: “What a truley Beautiful Old World Hotel !! & restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Bohunk562
Reviews.Content: Tho this Hotel has been in many Movies, it's a treat to actually walk in. On the Via Veneto, a short walk to the Embasies of the Worlds' Countries, and a minor walk to the grand estate & park like grounds of the Villa Borghese(a lil known MUST see Villa). The hotel provides many servicies, arranged a trip to Naples and fantastic Pompeii. walk to Spanish Steps & Trevi Fountain. i LOVED Rome..full of adventure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel...”
Reviews.Author: KerrieLS
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with fantastic room and very comfortable beds. Exceptional service and awesome food from the restaurant. Can't wait to return on our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous!!!”
Reviews.Author: cristianemendonca
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Grand Hotel Via Veneto and we loved everything!! The room is really good!!! The service is prefect and the breakfast either!! The Spa is also very good!!! We don't have reason to find another hotel in Rome. Congratulations!! Cristiane Mendonca

Reviews.Title: “A very decent, clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: danielt1000
Reviews.Content: All in all a very nice experience. Most of the staff was very friendly and helpful. Everyone speaks English quite well and I never got any attitude from someone. The room we stayed in was rather small but absolutely quiet, clean and with all the amenities you would ask for in a 5 star hotel. The location is very nice, with plenty of things to discover on foot in the vicinity (e.g. Villa borghese), however if you prefer to be a stone throw away from the Vatican or piazza di spagna, then this is not your hotel. The only negative experience I can remember was the over prized breakfast buffet, charging 70 Euros for 2 persons. That was the only stain in an otherwise spotless experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best Hotel in Rome - I can only thank my agent”
Reviews.Author: Adry M
Reviews.Content: The day after our arrival we saw Woody Allen making his new movie in this amazing hotel! Located on the best street in Rome: via Veneto, the dolce vita street. The room allocated was large and spacious, as was the bathroom. We had a 4th floor room which looked onto an internal courtyard, but the room was still very bright, and was very quiet. The bathroom was airy. The beds are so comfortable, I had the best night sleep in a hotel ever: the room is 100% free of noise. The only negative aspect is the garage: it’s external to the hotel! The Front Office staff was amazing, from the moment we arrived. The City-Spa is marvelous: do not miss the vitality pool! If you go there have a cocktail the whole experience is just out of this world. The hotel staff gets top ratings for both competence and professionalism: good job owner of Grand hotel via Veneto!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jukusa
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Via Veneto is luxury plus, On a scale of 1 - 5 star, I would give it a 7. Beautiful decor, wonderful staff, fabulous room, superb food. What else could you ask for. And Bvlgari bathroom accessories eg shampoo,soap,conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Hotel for a Four Star Price”
Reviews.Author: PrimoBeer
Reviews.Content: Simply THE best hotel we could ever have asked for in Rome. 5 Star hotel at a reasonable price. Check-in service was fabulous. Rooms were spacious (for European standards). Room amenities and decor was superb. The staff was exceedingly friendly, doormen most helpful. Food and drink service was delightful. It was truly well worth the expense, knowing the great value we received.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary - Impeccable - OUTSTANDING...can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: whills4
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Via Veneto provided us with the most fabulous thirthieth wedding anniversary pre celebration. We arrived in Rome on Sunday, July 3 and stayed at this wonderful establishment until Friday, July 8. It truly is the most magnificent hotel in Rome. FIVE STAR all the way! From Silvio at the front door, Gina who assisted us with transportation, the wonderful ladies in the SPA, and the courteous, collegial and knowledgeable staff at the front desk - we have to say again and again - Paolo Tulini Front Desk Supervisor, Roberta Valorani Booking Agent, and Ilaria Lucani CEO Personal Assistant, their service is second to none. This is truly a first class establishment. Having vacationed in Rome and stayed at such five star hotels as the Westin, Intercontinental, and the Marriot...they cannot compare to the GH Via Veneto. Its modern (they just opened in 2009), sleek, art deco style coupled with its outstanding customer service made our stay in Rome unforgettable. The rooms are spacious and immaculate. We had a room with an outdoor terrace that looked up the side street to the Via Veneto. One day my cousin from Grosseto (a nearby town) stopped in to visit us but we were out for the day. The staff welcomed hm and made sure we received the handwritten note that he left for us. Breakfast, which was included in our stay, was delicious. The staff - top notch! We enjoyed cappuccino and espresso each morning along with a variety of hot entrees (my husband loved the Eggs Benedict) all served in their beautiful Magnolia Dining Room. We were able to unwind each day in their beautiful SPA and relaxation room. The staff there always pampered us with hot teas, cool drinks and fresh fruit. The sauna and the steam room coupled with the salt water pool spa were a vigorous way to end a day of sightseeing and shopping! There were great restaurants within walking distance - be sure to try the fried stuffed olives and the hand cut prosciutto di parma. Walking to the Spanish Steps provided breathtaking views and fabulous shopping. The bar in the restaurant provided outstanding wine selections. We also enjoyed drinks in the evening right outside - sharing an apertif with visiting family one night...and just the two of us on other evenings....truly experiencing the Via Veneto and la dolce vita. Kudos to this fine establishment. We made sure when we walked to the Trevi Fountain (three different times during our stay) we threw our coins in so we can guarantee our return to Rome and to the GH Via Veneto. We are already planning our next trip! Thank you to the entire staff......you made our stay a most memorable one. Most sincerely, Theresa and George Licitra.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: rayoflightcanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night on my way back from Ravello, I found it great hotel and location, I walked in one night to Spanish steps, trevi fountain and piazza Della republica. On the time of arrival they showed me the room and how the facet works! Apparently it was a big deal for everybody and some complains! But I found it easy to navigate. I have asked them to wake me up at 6am and provide me with breakfast in the room and they did on time except the apologized to provide scrambled eggs instead the provided boiled eggs and of course I had to pay the 25 Euros as not included in the stay but I was happy with that. The most please surprise is to find the hotel next to famous Raphael the shoe store which is still there since the 70’s I heard about it from my auntie when she use to visit Roma back then!! The hotel is modern rather than the typical Italian design, I like it more than my stay at Aldrovandi Villa Borghese much much better and I can tell you I will be re book at this hotel next year for sure

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel serves as an oasis from the bustle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: tpa1521
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on Via Veneto, close to the Westin, Marriott and St. Regis. Yet, unlike those hotels, you will not find mobs of tourists. This seems to be a hidden jewel. Very attentive service, excellent rooms and one of the best breakfasts I've had in any hotel. They currently are running a Roman Summer promotion where the 3rd night is free, breakfast, spa and welcome drink included. It works out quite well relative to the other nice hotels in town. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “New Kid in town”
Reviews.Author: marcopaolo
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been completely refurbished and re-opend not long ago. The design and atmosphere are outstanding and you can feel the touch of the Bulgari ownership. the location is great with easy access to many intersting areas of downtown Rome for both pleasure and business. i was staying in a standard room and compared with many Rome hotels did not feel the size limitation which you often find. The rate which is not "cheap" is however interesting for the locaton and type of hotel, expecially if compared with the neightboring hotels, however i believe this is a kind of promotional rate so do not know until when it will last. The service is quite varying and you can meet different attitueds and capabilities, the impression is that some people are barely above apprentice level or under training o expect a great variation from this point of view. i did not unse any of the restarants/bar so cannot commet on this. definitely worth a try but if rates rise you want more from the service level point of view. jus a supid expample, when you arrive at the entrance door, depending on who is on duty you can expect a most warm and serviceous welcom or you might even have to open the door yourself ... A big issue I had was "connectivity": there was no mobile phone coverage in my room and I could not acces the wireless network which in my case, being on a business trip, was a geat inconvenience: if you need phone or internet connectivity I suggest you make it clear and make sure you get a suitable room.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: Lailonniel
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed there for three days during our honeymoon. The hotel itself is very nice and beautiful, the staff is very polite and helpful indeed. But I have to say that even though when we booked a room we left a comment that we're spending our honeymoon in this hotel on arrival none of the staff congratulated us with marrige. We were not actually hunting for some benifits but some congratulation or some special welcome in the room would have been nice and it was some attitude one expects to get in a 5 star Lux hotel. And they also wrote a wrong name on all the cards and bills and on TV welcome. They didn't just spell it wrong but it was totally someone else's name, not mine with the correct surname written next to it. This was sort of an unpleasant discovery and I don't understand how could the well trained stuff write a very hard to spell russian surname correctly and put someone else's name that didn't even look like mine next to it. The location is perect I have to say because you're practicly in the heart of Rome and everything you need to see is in walking distance from the hotel. At the same time it's not noicy in there at all, the windows of our room faced the inner yard which was quiete and beautiful and you could easely leave your windows opened for the night to get some fresh air. The hotel has a beautiful terrace on the top floor but we didn't have time to use it as we didn't stay long. The breakfast room was very nice as well but as for breakfast itself we definitely missed some hot dishes like eggs for example and the buffet didn't have much variety of foods and they served same things every day. It didn't bother us that much as we were only staying for 3 days but if we were to stay longer it surely could have been an issue. Another thing we had a problem with was our bathroom. The bathtub had a glass door which was supposed to protect the floor from splashes but it was practicly useless because it was leacking. So taking a shower always caused a huge puddle of water on the floor which was the least to say unsafe and unpleasant. We were not very happy about the cleaning in our bathroom too. The wall, opposite to the mirror was stained with something greasy or oily right from the day we arrived and the maid didn't bother to clean this in the 3 days we stayed. And I don't beleive she didn't notice that stain, I mean honestly it was impossible to miss something like this. Last but not least you have to be aware of their sistem of paiment. They freeze money on your account the day you arrive no matter which way of payment you choose in the end cash or another card it doesn't matter. They freeze the total cost of nights you'll be staying and as I was told, if you choose to pay in cash or with another card the money from the card they preauthorized will be returned that same day. But in reality I had to wait for 1,5 months for my money to be returned. Overall I'd say it's a good hotel in a good location it has it's flaws and overpriced rooms are one of it. But if you're looking for a good hotel in the centre of Rome and if you manage to get the rooms with a discount, like we did, it's a good place to consider.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star all the way”
Reviews.Author: Irfster
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and the hotel was the perfect choice. The hotel is immaculate, done to a very high standard with alot of attention to detail. Our room was very spacious and luxurious (and clean!) The staff were great and were always ready to help. The Spa had just opened up a couple of month previous and this is a great place to unwind after a day of touring the city. The Spa was amazing in particular the massive jacuzzi that they have. This is a great hotel located in a very lovely part of Italy. You may have to walk a little to get to the main attractions but by walking you get to see the street of Rome with events happening on every street corner. We would definately recommend this hotel Thanks to all the staff at the Grand Hotel Via Veneto - will stay here on our next trip to Rome without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: captus
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were clean I found it be a very bland hotel. The concierge or lack there of was completely inept. They had no idea what was going on in the city they live in. Would definitely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, definitely will use it in the future....again.”
Reviews.Author: pmdg
Reviews.Content: Being someone who travels to luxury hotels quite often, I was extremely impressed with the service and elegance of the hotel. Went there twice,for business and pleasure....and will keep going back. Fantastic location, spacious rooms,friendly and very competent staff. Food is excellent,overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Service! (Who is paying though???)”
Reviews.Author: Pete962008
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were supposed to stay at a different hotel in Rome, but when the hotel we were supposed to stay at overbooked, they booked us at the Grand Hotel for free! (I know lucky us). My wife and I had no idea how much the hotel was so we can't comment on that, however here are some points on the hotel: 1. Staff was incredible, they were always helpful, never rude, and always did the extra for you. 2. Breakfast was free each morning (very simple and great tasting). My wife and I were on a budget so we didn't eat at the hotel, however the food looked great. 3. Rooms were excellent, comfortable beds, nice shower, and 2 tvs, only negitave was our bed was between 2 buildings so we didn't get a nice view. 4. Location was okay, the street your located on is filled with expensive resturants, kinda of touristy as well. If money isn't too much of an option for you, you will be okay. The metro was a 15 minute walk, not too bad, a $10 euro cab fare to Rome Termini, and about 15 minutes to the Spanish Steps. 5. Spa-this was beautiful! Words really can't desribe how nice it was, definitly take advantage of it next time you stay at this hotel. Once again we never looked at the price for a room so we don't know how much it was...all in all it was a wonderful hotel! Thanks again to the wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Brand New - Excellent Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sasso718
Reviews.Content: We could not have been more pleased or impressed with the stunning decor, quality of service by the staff, room quality and cleanliness at The Grand Hotel Via Veneto. The rooms - spacious by European and even American standards - were VERY well appointed, modern, and super clean. Having still and sparkling water, fresh hot coffee, and tea in the lobby was a great addition, and this is just one of many many many examples of the attention to detail in the hotel. On my next trip to Rome, I wouldnt think of staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by this beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: traveledfar
Reviews.Content: The hotel and furnishings are beautiful in an art deco manner. Very expensive for a room looking at a wall. The showers in both of our rooms overflowed,apparently a design flaw. I didn't feel that this should be the case as we were paying basically about $700.00 per night. Nobody at the hotel seemed to be very upset by this issue in the hotel. I found it to be unacceptable, as we did not come to Rome to take a 2 minute shower. They don't really have a concierge. Matteo was a wonderful help as was Anna when we had a medical issue. Marco the doorman also very helpful. Breakfast is perfectly fine, but they don't remember to tell you that you can order egss cooked to order, in a lovely room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5* hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: smcnamee002
Reviews.Content: Really was a 5* hotel. Not cheap, but luxury never is. Service was impeccable, and the Spa downstairs was very good (not big but small and perfectly formed), with a kind of jacuzzi swimming pool and sauna and hamman. Location is nice, as its on a main street, with smart expensive cafes nearby). About a 20 min walk into Rome centre, or a quick taxi ride. Room was spotless and large. Rooms at the back of the hotel may not have a very nice view, but our room was larger than most. Service and Consierge were very helpful and friendly. I really enjoyed my stay. My wife liked it too. Breakfast, if purchased at €33/head is too expensive, but if it comes with the room, then its a really good local food buffet, or cooked breakfast. Rooftop bar (closed in April) would be good in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Not the value of a 5 stars deluxe!!!!”
Reviews.Author: derrikNY
Reviews.Content: I stay at this brand new property in Via Veneto and I was really not satisfied of the way they treat guest regarding to the pricing policy. I have booked the Hotel through internet and they gave me a room without view and the concierge did not respect what was written on my confirmation sheet. Then I have realized that the Hotel had a different price to the one originally confirmed after a double check on the web and they refused to honour the new price, and guess what it was of course less that the one I have paid! The Hotel is brand new with large room but this is it, don't trust them because they miss a price policy and the concierge seems not to be concern at all about this, like it is something not depending to his duty! Really upset about this way to sale.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, best location”
Reviews.Author: LPaolo
Reviews.Content: Amazing time in Roma at the GHVV. Nice and friendly staff, overall the structure is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lisatini1013
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 amazing nights at the Grand Hotel Via Veneto in September 2010. The hotel in a word; BEAUTIFUL! It has been recently completely renovated and they didn't miss a detail. The hotel is in a nice area of the city and we felt very safe there. Within walking distance to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The breakfast buffet is served in lovely rooms or an inside patio area. The staff is very attentive and the breakfast selection is overwhelming! So many delicious items to choose from! The Concierge staff was very helpful and friendly. You can't walk through the beautiful lobby without being greeted numerous times by wonderful polite employees. The Doorman was always there to greet us and help us out with directions. Our room was spacious and well appointed. The bathroom was a lovely surprise; very large for Europe with a great shower. I look forward to returning to the Eternal City and The Grand Hotel Via Veneto!

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better...”
Reviews.Author: luca33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great....we loved everything and certainly we will be back SOON!

Reviews.Title: “One of the loveliest and most hospitable hotels I've ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: LWC52
Reviews.Content: Although nothing is really a bargain for Americans since the Euro took power, this hotel is a true gem, no matter the price. There were a few inconveniences due to the fact they are still remodeling, but we weren't bothered by them so much. Located on the same street as the American Embassy, we never felt anything but safe. The staff is more than attentive to your needs and you will be treated like royalty here, whether your are or not. The entire staff pampered us with attention, making our stay quite lovely. If you're looking for a hassle free stay in Rome, this is your place, but you have to pay for this privilege. Best of all, the rooms are spacious & the bathrooms even more so. It was a slice of Heaven I'd like to return to someday soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, 5-star service”
Reviews.Author: beerdrinker2005
Reviews.Content: Location is in a "ritzy" part of downtown but that means abundant nearby restaurants with patios on Via Veneto and less expensive ones off side streets. Traffic noise not bad and rooms are very quiet (occasional internal noise).Large comfortable lobby but no English language newspapers. On PC off lounge area. Breakfast buffet at 33 Euro is non-competitive with adjacent restaurants even given the quiet internal outdoor patio. Rooms are spacious, with comfortable king bed and soft pillows, small desk with Internet connection, minibar (8 euro beers), white marble bath and full tub, bidet, walk-in closet with safe and hair dryer, small lacquered redwood table near window that opens. Brown fabric walls with framed painting. Flat screen TV with 50 international channels, some repeatedly "unavailable". Good high-speed Internet connection (wired). Bathroom with 110/220 North American/European outlets. A/C unit kept resetting to "frigid". No clothes iron (claimed not legal). 40-50 euro taxi ride from airport. Nearby Metro stop. Expectedly expensive bar. Small outdoor patio facing traffic. Helpful and attentive staff. New property, rates do not include breakfast. No spa or fitness room yet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel; Staff genuinely nice and helpful”
Reviews.Author: dagas
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a good place to stay in Rome with a pool and certainty on quality. A Travel Agent suggested this hotel (which does not have a pool and has its spa soon-to-open) and the price was very good for this category. I decided to skip the pool b/c I had to stay farther north to get it or at the Hotel de Russie perhaps (where I stayed last time - very nice - but did not want to spend that much). Gave this a try and was not disappointed. Recently opened and thus redone so it was very nice inside. Room was a junior suite (seating area but no separate room) and quite large. View was over the street but its not really a view hotel. Front desk staff was very helpful with tickets and suggestions. Bell men were very friendly and helpful. Fitness room is not much to speak of so I hope that is still being embellished. Got my exercise walking Rome instead. Breakfast was excellent (included in our price. I would find it too much to spend for breakfast if not at 33 euros or so). Via Veneto is not a bad location but at the northern limit of where I like to stay. Some like the location a lot; for me there are better ones -- but for the overall package, it worked out great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, minus a few things...”
Reviews.Author: Tphantran
Reviews.Content: i'll start off by saying that i'm what they call a 'snooty' traveler. I want the best, and willing to pay for it. Location: This hotel is in a good location - if it was maybe 10years ago. Via Veneto was considered the 'hot spot' to be and be seen. now it's just sort of drab. to get into the thick of the hustle/bustle, it's about a 10min walk. good restaurants nearby are scarce. but nonetheless, definitely a safe area of town - mostly business hotels and nice high end (but empty) restaurants. This is also located a block away from the Westin Excelsior. (which is about 300+Euro more per night than GHVV) Food: the morning breakfast buffet was probably one of the highlights of the amenities at the hotel. endless options and full on breakfast items like bacon, sausages, eggs, etc. great juice and dietary options. great smoked salmon which paired wonderfuly with the toasty croissants. Rooms: we booked the grand deluxe king room and what we got was a room with a window...facing the courtyard of the hotel. virtually no kind of view. when i called to try to move rooms, they said the only rooms that have an 'outside' view are the suites. what?! anyway, we got over it. we're only in the room between midnight at 8am. Now the best part of the hotel was their bathroom. beuatiful white carrera marble and bamboo wood. the rain shower and water pressure was awesome. i'm picky about bathrooms, and this was 5star on my list! overall, a great hotel for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Should be More Well Known”
Reviews.Author: fultonferry
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about booking this hotel because of the small number of reviews on Trip Advisor, but all of them were good and rightfully so. I'm surprised that this hotel isn't mentioned more as a great upscale place to stay in Rome. The building, which I think was at at some point a Villa, is beautiful and rooms are large, immaculately maintained and the service is outstanding. Check-in is at a desk, not a counter, and before I had a chance to turn around my bags were already in my room. Everyone was genuinely friendly. I never heard loud banging doors or employees talking in the hallway. Breakfast was a nice buffet and room service food was good, although might be a little better for an upscale place. If there are negatives it would be a very, very hard mattress, which worked for my bad back but might be a problem for others. The hotel's decor is also unapologetically Art Deco, which makes the rooms less than modern looking, but interesting. The bathroom is wonderful, but it lacks a television which I guess some would think would make it a 5 star, and there were no in-room city-magazines or maps to browse through. The hotel is at the top of the Via Veneto, which is either a plus or minus. I liked being close to the Villa Borghese -- the Central Park of Rome -- but it is away from most of the big-ticket ruins like the Forum. It is about a 20 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. On the other hand, I found it nicer to return to the quiet and safe area of the Villa Borghese after a day of tourist-central. The metro is about a 10 minute walk away. The Via Veneto restaurants have seen better days and now seem a little trashy and stuck in time, but that may be why the hotels there are slightly less expensive than those in more trendy areas. There are more well known hotels next door like The Westin Excelsior, but I doubt that the service is as good or the atmosphere as peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel and service!”
Reviews.Author: harlemfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel for 5 nights, partly business and partly vacation. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left, the service was outstanding! Uniformly outstanding! Although we arrived at 8:30 am our room was ready and they did not bat an eye about our early arrival. The hotel has a wonderful treat of having complementary coffee, tea, water and juice in the lobby all day! The rooms are very comfortable and very modern. Extremely clever key system that turns the lights and AC on when you open the door. Towels are plentiful and housekeeping comes twice per day and changes all towels. (However, housekeeping did not give us soap or toilet paper for two days...a minor ding.) We also liked that the bed was a real queen (not two beds together like most hotels in Europe) but the bed could be a bit more comfortable. Internet was free - also a big deal in Europe where internet can be very costly. The staff at the front desk also could do enough to help us and called us by name. Breakfast was nice but a bit expensive (for us it was included in the room rate for the conference.) We did not try the restaurant or bar. The location is very nice - close to the Villa Borgese. In summary, a really spectacular hotel (and we have stayed at many...) - a definite MUST to visit if you are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “You Must Stay At This Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: owenbouy
Reviews.Content: This is really the best Hotel I have ever stayed in even tops the 4 Seasons in NYC !!!! The setting is wonderful, the rooms bright,clean and very large bathrooms are lovely with a fantastic rain shower, we stayed in a Deluxe King Room, the service amazing, nothing was too much of a problem . We ate at the restuarant twice and it was superb as well, the bar was relaxing and did excellent Martini's. With just a 10 minute stroll to the spanish steps you are near everything but just far enough away to relax and rest, there is noise in the rooms at night and the air con is excellent. One day we forgot to take the do not disturb sign off the door but thet came and fully serviced our room at 9.30pm !! I cannot recommend this hotle enough please please please if you are looking for a wonderful hotel in a wonderful city this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Diana8207
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, very good location. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: London_UKRogerJ
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The service was brilliant. Rooms and bathrooms are very well decorated. The front desk very helpful and extremely polite. Would certainly stay in this establishment again and would not hesitate to recommend to both business and leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfectly Perfect Roman Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PaulJude
Reviews.Content: We literally stumbled upon the hotel. We were originally going to stay in the Rome Sofitel hotel. Upon check in our room was at least 85 degrees. We decided to take a walk around the area while they tried to fix our air conditioning. One block up the street was The Grand Hotel Via Veneto. We walked into the lobby and fell in love. Newly opened only three weeks prior, we walked into the most elegantly done Art Deco inspired lobby. Gleaming marble floors, beautiful furniture and understated floral arrangements-all perfectly complimenting each other. We asked to speak to the manager to see if there were rooms available....and the answer was "yes". When we asked if we could see a room, the manager was gracious and welcoming and took us up to a "standard" room himself. It was exactly the type of hotel we imagined when we originally booked our vacation. Clean modern lines, beautiful views and an amazingly beautiful bathroom. And the airconditioning could bring the room temperature down as low as we could possibly want. For the remaining week, the staff had the perfect recommendations for dinners, tours and sight seeing. Lastly, the location was exactly where we imagine everyone would want to stay........on the top of the Via Veneto, within walking distance of many of the sights of Rome and within easy distance of public and private transportation. A traditional Roman breakfast is included with your room. An admittedly expensive stay in Rome but well worth is if you want the most perfectly perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait for opening”
Reviews.Author: Mandy_SF
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my trip to Italy, 3 days Rome, Florence, Amalfi coast for July and unfortunately I received some days ago a message from the hotel that it will not be open on time. Of course, it was a big surprise for us as everything is booked already, from the tickets to the private guide but I want to express my personal opinion in how this situation was treated by the hotel. They provided excellent customer service, offering an alternate hotel and booking for us all additional services like transfer, private guide, 2 restaurants. I would have prefered to stay at the 155 but at the same time they took very good care of my reservation and all my requests what is showing how professional they work. As soon as the hotel will open, it will be the first hotel on my list to try hoping to find the same persons who were taking care of my reservation now. Special thank you to Valeria & Claudia from the reservation/ sales office!

Reviews.Title: “Another non-user review”
Reviews.Author: IKDR
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for 8-11 June, thanking my lucky stars that I hadn't tried to go in April, like the other user review. I have just had MY booking cancelled as they hotel apparently STILL isn't ready. Of course, at this short notice most of the other comparable hotels are full. Seeing as this hotel is part of a reputable group, this is very disappointing, and I certainly shall avoid the group in future.

HotelInfo.Name: Jumeirah Grand Hotel Via Veneto
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vittorio Veneto, 155, 00187 Rome, Italy
